data.name: 350 Argentina
data.description: En Argentina trabajamos con el movimiento 350.org Argentina y articulamos actividades con las distintas Asambleas Ambientales del País: La Asamblea Ciudadana de Concordia (Provincia de Entre Ríos) – La Asamblea Jachal No Se Toca (Provincia de San Juan), con la Asamblea Patagonia NO Nuclear, con la Multisectorial antiextractivista, con la Fundación Protágonos.

data.name: 350 Brisbane
data.description:
350 Brisbane is working locally to help build the global 350.org movement to solve the climate crisis and transition to a clean, renewable energy future.
Queenslanders are the guardians of the Great Barrier Reef, the Earths largest coral reef system.
Queensland is also home to the Galilee Basin, an inland area with current estimates of 27,750 million tonnes of coal, or 5% of the Worlds current Carbon budget. 
Six mines are planned for this area, together with three railway alignments, two coal‐fired power stations and two massive port expansions. 
350.org Brisbane was formed in June 2013, to run forums on divestment, superannuation education nights, and offer opportunities for Queenslanders throughout the regions to take meaningful action to protect the Reef and the Planet.
We meet fortnightly and are always looking for volunteers. Join us. More details Facebook 350Queensland

data.name: 350 Byron Bay
data.description: 350 Byron is a small but committed group of inviduals working to educate and empower people to take action on climate change and divest from the fossil fuel industry.

data.name: 350 Canberra
data.description: 350.org Canberra is powered by volunteers, with folks from all walks of life taking part in our local climate campaigns.  We engage with the ACT Government, calling on them to divest from fossil fuels — we support movements that are standing up to the fossil fuel industry on the frontline — and are reaching out to Canberrans, connecting the local with the global climate movement.

data.name: 350 Melbourne
data.description: 350 Melbourne meets weekly on Monday evenings. Our core group is focused on getting local councils across the state to change banks to those which don't lend to fossil fuel projects, and we also have a community engagement group which aims to spread the word about divestment and seed local campaigns. We're always looking for new people, and have recently added someone to focus on divestment in religious organisations. If you're interested in helping to build on this work and extend it into new areas we'd love to hear from you!

data.name: 350.org Australia
data.description: From Australia, we're joining the global movement, 350.org that's inspiring the world to rise to the challenge of the climate crisis. From divestment campaigning to campaigns taking peaceful action to confront the fossil fuel industry, 350.org Australia works collaboratively with various organisations and our active supporter base of thousands.

data.name: 350 Hobart
data.description: 350 Hobart is a group of dedicated individuals of all ages working to spread the climate message and divest our universities, local government and religious organisations from the fossil fuel industry.

data.name: 350 Perth
data.description: Perth 350 run regular community events and meet on the third Thursday of each month.  We support individuals and institutions to Divest and work to increase public awareness of the need for urgent and effective climate action.  We are working to build the broader climate movement, including developing NVDA capacity and legal support within the community.  We are keen to work with individuals, groups and organisations in pursuit creating a safe climate.

data.name: 350 Sydney
data.description: The Sydney chapter of 350.org Australia, we have regular monthly meetings to discuss the state of the world and our plans to change it. Members are running Fossil Free campaings at the major universities in Sydney, and we also run education and outreach events publicly while tying in with other 350 activities around the country. We're always looking for more keen volunteers to help out, no matter your skills set, so drop us a line if you'd like to get involved. Sydney Coordinators are Isaac & Maggie.

data.name: 350.org Belgium
data.description: We are building a citizen climate activist movement in Belgium. We are part of a creative, non-violent and open movement that aims to engage the people of Belgium and beyond in being part of the solution to catastrophic climate disruption. We organise in a horizontal way and are open to anyone who wants to be part of the solution to the climate crisis. We help with local struggles and also play a part in the European and global movements in addressing the border-less issue that climate change poses. We play our part in creating a more just and equitable world for the future generations that come after us.

data.name: 350 Salvador
data.description: Desde 2010 que há um grupo informal de pessoas realizando ações da 350.org Brasil na cidade, mas somente em 2012 que o grupo de voluntários foi capacitado e formalmente incorporado como um grupo. Temos participado de todas as ações globais desde então. Além delas, realizamos ações locais.

data.name: 350 Hearst
data.description: Nous sommes un regroupement communautaire de personnes concernées par l’environnement et par l’état de la planète.

data.name: 350 Ottawa
data.description: Welcome to 350 Ottawa! It's happening everywhere: people all over the world are coming together to launch climate campaigns, collaborate on projects, and build a clean energy future. Join us at 350 Ottawa to help build this!

data.name: 350 Grey-Bruce – Owen Sound
data.description: We are a loosely affiliated group of people who are taking action on climate change by embracing non-violent direct action against the continued production, promotion and subsidization of fossil fuels and for the use of sustainable, ecologically sound energy alternatives consistent with the guiding principles of the 350.org movement and specifically inspired by the 350.org movie “Do the Math”.

data.name: Calgary Climate Action Network
data.description: The Calgary Climate Action Network brings together Calgarians tackling climate change to make our work stronger. We are innovators, activists, storytellers, and people, and we know we are stronger together.

data.name: Alliance 4 Democracy
data.description: We are a group organized to promote true democracy in Canada. We are active in environmental and social issues, as well as taking an active role in politics. We support action on climate change and oppose the Site C dam, oil pipelines, dirty oil and gas shipments. We support the introduction of a proportional representation system of voting for the federal government in Canada.

data.name: Hamilton 350
data.description: We are a group of Hamilton area activists working towards solutions to the climate crisis. Join us!

data.name: Kamloops 350
data.description: Kamloops 350 is a diverse, grassroots group which believes in the axiom "think globally, act locally."  Right now we're partnering with the City of Kamloops to encourage residents to make some kind of "green pledge" for Earth Day.  Plant a tree, park your car, install an LED bulb --- whatever works for you.  Post your pledge on Facebook at the Earth Day Kamloops page.  Join us and help Kamloopsians to reduce their climate risk impact!

data.name: 350 Kingston
data.description: We are a group of citizens in Kingston, Ontario, committed to taking action on climate change. We recognize climate disruption as a global crisis and we believe we can shift the status quo by focusing on community and pushing our government for real change.

data.name: Toronto350
data.description: Toronto350 is a local group formed in 2012.  We work to promote leadership in climate action.  We are building a local but global, grassroots movement to solve the climate crisis. Please visit our social media on twitter, facebook and instagram or visit our website toronto350.org.  Hope to see you soon!

data.name: 350_Vancouver
data.description: 350_Vancouver is an ever growing group of committed citizens who work to advance the understanding that the solution to climate change lies in our society making the transition from fossil fuel energy towards renewable energy sources. We know this cannot happen by individual efforts alone but requires strong public policies, consumer incentives, improved public transit, walking and biking infrastructure and moving government subsidies away from the fossil fuel industry and toward renewable energy sources. This transition must begin today and we invite our local neighbours to join us in working with 350.org globally to achieve climate safety.

data.name: UBCC350
data.description: We are students, staff, and faculty at the University of British Columbia dedicated to using political action to address the climate crisis. We are committed to fostering government action to reduce exports of greenhouse gases from British Columbia, especially from coal and tar sands pipelines. We also advocate UBC divestment from fossil fuels.

data.name: Manitoba Energy Justice Coalition
data.description: A coalition of Manitobans concerned with TransCanada's EnergyEast Pipeline as an expression of energy injustice in Manitoba.

data.name: 350Shenzhen Coco Huang
data.description: 350 SZ is an official affiliate of 350.org. It was established by 30 students from the Shenzhen Foreign Languages School who are passionate about making China a more environmentally conscious country. Due to its robust educational initiatives and proactive programs, 350 SZ now boasts 100+ members of all ages throughout Guangdong province. 350 SZ’s ultimate objective is to create a union of environmental advocacy organizations throughout Mainland China that will support the multifaceted mission of 350.org worldwide.

data.description: 350 CÃ´te dâIvoireâs a local branch of the International NGO 350.org which aims to fight against climate change, fossils fuels, and educate people about how to live in a green world. *Collaborate activity, maintain visibility on social website, and keep local population aware of climate change risk. Education and Certificate-Training. The 350 Abidjan group started organizing for Moving Planet on September 24th, and is still going strong as 350 CÃ´te d'ivoire!

data.name: 350 Denmark - Klimabevægelsen I Danmark
data.description: Started in 2008 as "the Danish climate movement", 350 Denmark has carried out a large number of activities related to bringing awareness to the climate problem and solutions. We help organize mobilisations and events, host debate evenings with prominent politicians and experts on solving the climate crises, and have under the campaign name Ansvarligfremtid helped bring climate to the attention of the Danish pension sector and municipalities.

data.name: 350 Egypt
data.description: We are associated with 350 Egypt, and have participated in multiple 350 events in the past. We are now organizing around transportation solutions.

data.name: 350 Finland
data.description: 350 Suomi on osa globaalia opiskelijalähtöistä kansalaisliikettä (350.org), joka edistää konkreettisia tieteeseen ja oikeudenmukaisuuteen perustuvia ratkaisuja ilmastonmuutokseen yhteisötasolla, sekä pyrkii aktivoimaan nuoria vaikuttamaan heidän tärkeiksi katsomiinsa asioihin. Yhdessä verkosto järjestää tuhansia tapahtumia, mielenosoituksia ja verkkokampanjoita 188 maassa ympäri maailmaa. Tule mukaan, meitä kaikkia tarvitaan ilmastokriisin ratkaisemisessa!

data.name: 350 G-ROC (Ghana reducing our carbon)
data.description: G- ROC is a grassroots movement formed with the aim of mobilizing and empowering young people in partnership with key stakeholders to actively champion the need to reduce our carbon emissions as a key effort in combating climate change.

data.name: 350 Hong Kong
data.description: 350.HK is the natural extension of 「文明急救組」that aims to widen and deepen our scope of combating global warming. With the alliance of the global network and resource of 350.org., greater social impact and synergy can be achieved. We envisage climate justice will be another wave of significant civil movement in Hong Kong.

data.name: 350 Indonesia
data.description:
Kami percaya bahwa iklim dan masa depan yang lebih baik--dunia yang yang dikelola secara adil, setara dan sejahtera--dapat dibangun oleh dari kekuatan masyarakat biasa.

Kami membangun gerakan iklim global. Stop #energikotor bahan bakar fosil. Dukung transisi 100% energi terbarukan.

data.name: Italian Climate Network
data.description: Italian Climate Network is an association composed by citizens, companies and NGOs engaged in taking on climate  change and promoting a shift in the economic system towards a model characterized by low levels of greenhouse gas emissions. Founded in 2011, Italian Climate Network works with a wide range of actors both from the public and private sector with the aim to raise the awareness about climate change and take action for tackling it. Its activities include but are not limited to scientific as well as general-audience-oriented divulgation on climate topics, participation to the UNFCCC negotiates and the organization of numerous events and campaigns.

data.description: 気候変動に立ち向かうムーブメントを構築しています

data.name: 350 Kenya
data.description: This is a network of dedicated young Kenyans out to tackle climate change.

data.name: 350-Kenya Power Shift
data.description: Kenya Power Shift is a growing movement of young people passionate about taking action to combat climate change in Kenya. Anyone is welcome to join the effort! Contact us at 350kenya@gmail.com or other ways.

data.name: 350 CDMX
data.description: Un grupo para que podamos ponernos de acuerdo y organizar distintas actividades relacionadas con medio ambiente y cambio climático desde la CDMX

data.name: 350 Mexico
data.description: En México los grupos locales 350 CDM y el grupo de estudiantes del Centro de Investigación y Desarrollo en Educación Bilingüe (CIDEB) de Monterrey, México.

data.name: 350 Dumaguete
data.description: 350Dumaguete is composed of different youth leaders from the Province of Negros Oriental who aims to create a strong awareness campaign for Climate Change, it is to remind every human being of its responsibilities in facing  this climate crisis.

data.name: 350 Aotearoa
data.description: 350 Aotearoa is the New Zealand arm of the international climate movement 350.org, campaigning to turn New Zealand into a climate leader, and to keep fossil fuels in the ground. We have a small team based in Auckland, who support teams of organisers around the country.

data.name: 350 Auckland
data.description:
350 Auckland is a small but energetic group of individuals doing groundwork and spreading the word about climate justice and Fossil fuel divestment downunder. We are a diverse group, among us we have students, retirees, electricians, engineers and one  guy who can apparently do everything from organising festivals right through to coding and brewing Feijoa wine. Climate change activism does have its serious side but we dont get too bogged down with that. We intend to reclaim our public spaces through the principles of artivism, attractivism and.... fun-ivism. Our goal is to be disruptive, but inclusive, getting the public involved and demonstrating that while our politicians faf about, the people have the power to fix everything- from the ground up. 
Contact: auckland@350.org.nz

data.name: 350 Christchurch
data.description:
We are a diverse group of activists working to make change in Otautahi (Christchurch) and beyond! We're working to mobilise people around climate solutions. Join us!
Contact: 350christchurch@gmail.com

data.name: 350 Wellington
data.description:
Wellington, the capital of NZ, is a hot bed of globally-minded public servants, academics, students and savvy tech-heads and artists, and this is reflected in the diverse range group of individuals that make up 350 Wellington. Our primary focus is on encouraging local bodies and institutions in the Wellington region to divest themselves of their fossil fuel assets as well as growing the local grassroots movement.
Contact: Wellington@350.org.nz

data.name: 350 Niue
data.description: 350 Niue is part of an international campaign. Who recognise climate change as our generation’s greatest adversary,but the warrior spirit within enables us to battle on, and rise above the challenge.

data.name: 350 PNG
data.description: 350 PNG first formed with the help of the Youth Against Corruption Association (YACA) in Sept 2013, and today 350 PNG still operates under it. 350 PNG the first youth climate change movement in PNG. 350 PNG works to educate and empower the young people within PNG to fight back against climate change.

data.name: 350 Paraguay
data.description: En Paraguay articulamos actividades con la Mesa de Articulación Indígena de Paraguay (MAIPY) y vamos a lanzar el movimiento 350.org Paraguay.

data.name: 350 Peru
data.description: En Perú, 350.org trabaja con el referente ambiental Osver Polo Carrasco y el Movimiento Ciudadano Frente al Cambio Climático (MOCICC)

data.name: 350 Philippinas
data.description: 350.org Pilipinas is a part of the 350.org global grassroots movement working to unite the world around solutions to the climate crisis.

data.name: 350 Singapore
data.description: 350 Singapore was founded by Young NTUC in March 2010. It is the Singapore chapter to the global 350.org movement. 350 is widely believed by many scientists to be the safe upper limit of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, measured in parts per million.

data.name: 350 Barcelona
data.description: 350 BCN: Barcelona's contribution to the People's Climate Movement. A network of organizations, a group of committed individuals. We seek to grow the movement in Barcelona by connecting the dots between the Climate Crisis and the solutions we can all apply: companies, governments and citizens alike.

data.name: Association Climat Genève
data.description: Association Climat Genève aims to increase public awareness of climate change and help our Swiss politicians adopt a more ambitious policy to diminish our CO2 emissions. We are planning several actions leading up to COP21 and the debate on the Energie 2050 law in Swiss parliament.

data.name: myblueplanet
data.description: myblueplanet is a Swiss non-profit, volunteer-based organization dedicated to fighting climate change. Based in Winterthur near Zurich, we work to inspire, empower, mobilise and unite people of all backgrounds and ages to take positive action on climate change.

data.name: 350 Taiwan
data.description:
We aim to support climate movement in the country between youth and environmental movement, especially on divestment campaign to build the power on the ground toward fossil free future.
國際環保組織 350.org，為正在全球建立能解決氣候危機運動的國際NGO。我們在網路上的串連活動、草根性組織以及廣大公民行動，在全球超過 188 國活躍進行著。數字「350」是氣候變遷的安全指標，為維持一個適合居住的星球，大氣中的二氧化碳含量必須從目前400ppm（百萬分之一）濃度降低至350ppm。

data.name: 350 Tonga
data.description: Tonga 350 was first established in 2010, and has since had many members come and go. Tonga 350 is still going very strong! We want to keep recruiting for 2014, and our first goal of the year is to sit down with new members to set up a proper communication channel.

data.name: 350 Tuvalu
data.description: Established in 2012, 350 Tuvalu believes in collective activism as a means of combating climate change. 350 Tuvalu has large global ambitions, The group is small however dedicated the group mainly comprises of passionate school children from the Motufoua Secondary School

data.name: People of Albany United for Safe Energy (PAUSE)
data.description: PAUSE is a grassroots group of individuals who have come together to promote safe, sustainable energy and fight for environmental justice. We engage the greater public to stop the fossil fuel industry’s assault on the people of Albany and our environment. Our work reaches out to people and groups around the globe who strive for an end to the ruinous fossil fuel economy and to replace it with a just, sustainable, and distributed system of work that meets people’s real needs and does not destroy the Earth’s climate.

data.name: 350 New Mexico
data.description: As New Mexicans, we always stand up for our land & our people. We move to win clean energy for our state, and toward a goal that's as real as it is vital: 350ppm. Get involved in New Mexico's transformation to a thriving clean energy economy.

data.name: Climate Action Now Western Massachusetts
data.description: Climate Action Now is dedicated to building a powerful, unstoppable climate justice movement in our corner of the world--a movement that we see as essential to preventing climate catastrophe--while inventing new ways to live together on this earth. We are an inclusive, grassroots community of people, connected by our passion to preserve a livable world and create a more just society through organizing, action and public education.

data.name: 350 Arlington
data.description: Arlington 350 pursues climate campaigns invented or selected by its participants, especially campaigns focused in Arlington and Virginia. Leaders welcome!

data.name: 350 Asheville
data.description: We are working together to secure a healthy planet for this and future generations. We are taking climate action now to promote real and lasting social and environmental justice for all people.

data.name: Climate Crusaders
data.description: We formed as an offshoot of the Georgia Climate Change Coalition, in order to be able to get involved in a more active way.

data.name: 350 Atlanta
data.description: 350 ATL is building a climate movement in Atlanta crossing traditional lines of division and creating ways to unite our diverse people around a vision of our future that we can all work for. There is a lot to do, so come add your ideas and energy to ours, and let’s get started!

data.name: 350 Austin
data.description: 350 Austin is a local, grassroots organization committed to the goals and strategies of 350.org. We believe that 350 Austin may be uniquely positioned to influence the direction of climate change action. This is because Austin is the capital of Texas, a state with a long history with the fossil fuel industry, including production, processing and distribution of fossil fuels.

data.name: 350 Bellingham
data.description: 350 Bellingham is here to help raise awareness on the impacts of climate change and participate in the global, national and regional 350.org days of action, at the local level. We also support the regional campaign at Power Past Coal, to stop North America's largest proposed coal export terminal along with the divestment campaign at Western Washington University. You can find us on Facebook www.facebook.com/350bellingham and Twitter @350Bellingham.

data.name: 350 Deschutes
data.description: 350 Deschutes is organizing our local community to combat the climate crisis and build a better future for Oregonians

data.name: 350 Indiana - Bloomington
data.description: Our 350 Indiana - Bloomington group is formed with the purpose of coordinating local activities with the global campaigns of 350.org

data.name: 350 Massachusetts
data.description: 350 Mass is a statewide, volunteer-led climate action network with ten “nodes”, or chapters, all over Massachusetts. 350 Mass volunteers work together to mobilize their communities, reach out to their friends and neighbors, and run hard-hitting campaigns to demand bold climate action at the state and local level. Join us! Learn more and find a node near you at www.350ma.org, or email info@350ma.org.

data.name: 350MA-Boston
data.description: Join the Boston node of 350 Mass! 350 Mass is made up of hundreds of highly engaged volunteers all over the state, supported by staff from Better Future Project. 350 Mass educates the public about global warming and advocates for change through hard-hitting campaigns chosen by volunteers  The Boston node of 350 Mass draws people from Brookline, Boston, Roslindale, West Roxbury and beyond. There's a potluck before each meeting, and node members often head out to Doyle's for drinks and snacks afterwards. You can get in touch with the node leaders by emailing Boston@350ma.org. Check out www.350ma.org for more info, including the location, date and time of the next Boston node meeting.

data.name: 350 Boulder
data.description: 350 Boulder is working locally to help solve the global climate crisis and transition from fossil fuels to a sustainable future.  We promote local clean energy, locally-grown organic food, low-GHG planning and transportation, no fracking, and a community that's resilient to the challenges we face from extreme weather and ever rising fossil fuel prices.  We meet monthly and are happy to welcome new members to our team to help lead the transition to a safe, healthy future!

data.name: 350 Colorado
data.description: 350 Colorado is working locally to help build the global 350.org movement to solve the climate crisis and transition to a clean, renewable energy future.

data.name: Bronx Climate Justice North
data.description: Bronx Climate Justice North is a grassroots climate justice organization and alliance based in the North Bronx. We work in solidarity with partners in Bronx Climate Justice South, a coalition of environmental justice organizations in the South Bronx. We are an advocacy and an educational organization. We're organizing for a transition to 100% renewable energy by 2030, and many other systemic climate justice initiatives in the Bronx, and beyond.

data.name: 350 Brooklyn
data.description: 350Brooklyn is an affiliate of 350.org that works locally to solve the climate crisis through education, organization, and direct action.

data.name: 350MA-Cambridge
data.description: Join the Cambridge node of 350 Mass! 350 Mass is made up of hundreds of highly engaged volunteers all over the state, supported by staff from Better Future Project. 350 Mass educates the public about global warming and advocates for change through hard-hitting campaigns chosen by volunteers. The Cambridge node of 350Mass has been meeting regularly since June 2012. Most Cambridge node members live in Somerville or Cambridge, but there are also regular attendees from Arlington, Lexington, Medford, and other nearby towns. You can get in touch with the node leaders by emailing Cambridge@350ma.org. Check out www.350ma.org for more info, including the location, date and time of the next Cambridge node meeting.

data.name: 350 Conejo / San Fernando Valley
data.description: 350 Conejo / San Fernando Valley is proud to be part of the growing global climate movement. In an area with a population of nearly two million, we stand up against fossil fuels and organize for renewable energy.

data.name: 350 Cape Cod
data.description: Join the Cape Cod node of 350 Mass! 350 Mass is made up of hundreds of highly engaged volunteers all over the state, supported by staff from Better Future Project. 350 Mass educates the public about climate change and advocates for change through hard-hitting campaigns chosen by volunteers. If you'd like to get in touch, email capecod@350ma.org. Check out www.350ma.org for more info, including the location, date and time of the next meeting.

data.name: Iowa 350
data.description: IOWA 350 is a group of caring people concerned about the future of our planet and we’re taking action to address climate change now. Together we’ll develop and implement creative campaigns to address our climate crisis. We are organized to raise climate consciousness, take action to improve our environment, and encourage sustainable progress through local initiatives and events.

data.name: 350 Central Virginia
data.description: 350 is building a global grassroots movement to solve the climate crisis. Our chapter formed to tackle the big polluters in the central Virginia region, and to focus on solutions to bring our area the clean, sustainable energy choices we need.

data.name: 350 Colorado Springs
data.description: 350 Colorado Springs is growing a grassroots movement of committed individuals and businesses that want to promote the health and vitality of Colorado Springs through education and local advocacy. We seek to educate the community about ways to improve energy efficiency and implement renewable energy solutions as well as to advocate for the adoption of a long-term sustainability plan to guide major decisions for our energy future.

data.name: HoCo Climate Change
data.description: HoCo Climate Change is an all-volunteer group of Howard County citizens who are working to reduce Howard County's carbon footprint and to promote a clean energy future. We can't do it alone. We need your help.

data.name: 350 Columbia
data.description: 350 Columbia fights for all issues of environmental justice and seeks to organize alliances with other grassroots, social justice, and opposition groups in the Carolinas. We organize protests, meetings, and press events on a weekly basis.

data.name: Simply Living
data.description: Simply Living of Central Ohio supports individuals, families and organizations in creating a more compassionate and sustainable world by offering learning opportunities which promote personal and civic responsibility, informed action and wholeness.

data.name: 350 Connecticut
data.description: 350 Connecticut is a project to organize a strong, responsive grassroots coalition of citizens, NGO's, faith communities and businesses across the state of Connecticut to envision and build a future beyond fossil fuels.

data.name: 350 Dallas
data.description: 350 Dallas is building a climate movement in Dallas, Texas.

data.name: 350Kishwaukee

data.name: 350 Denver
data.description: 350Denver is organizing passionate climate activists and allies throughout the city of Denver to grow awareness and action on climate issues. All are welcome!

data.name: Elgin Green Groups 350
data.description: "EGG350" is the local affiliate of 350.org in Elgin, IL.

data.name: 350 Eugene
data.description: 350 Eugene is a local affiliate of 350.org, started in January 2014. We are building a joy-filled, powerful and effective grassroots climate movement to quickly transition to a 100% renewable energy democracy through focused civic engagement.

data.name: 350 Humboldt
data.description: Our core mission is to keep fossil fuels in the ground while swiftly transitioning to an equitable, low-carbon future.

data.name: 350 Everett
data.description: We are folks in and around Everett concerned about climate change and all the many implications. We have workgroups focusing on local changes in energy, transportation, food, etc. We organize and support state-wide and national actions on climate change.

data.name: 350 Fairfax
data.description: We are building a grassroots movement in Fairfax County, Virginia, to challenge systems that lead to catastrophic climate change.

data.name: 350 Mass Greater Franklin
data.description: Join the Greater Franklin node of 350 Mass! 350 Mass is made up of hundreds of highly engaged volunteers all over the state, supported by staff from Better Future Project. 350 Mass educates the public about global warming and advocates for change through hard-hitting campaigns chosen by volunteers. If you'd like to get in touch, email franklin@350ma.org. Check out www.350ma.org for more info, including the location, date and time of the next meeting.

data.name: 350 Indiana - Calumet
data.description: 350 Indiana - Calumet aims to inspire Hoosiers to rise to the challenge of the climate crisis, to create a new sense of urgency and possibility for our planet. We work to build a social movement by empowering individuals, groups and communities to act collectively in addressing the climate crisis.

data.name: 350 Eastside
data.description: 350 Eastside is building a climate justice movement on the Eastside. We endeavor to bring passionate people together for the purpose of creating a world in which all can thrive now and into the future. We focus on policy, advocacy, education and creative direct action to bring about the changes necessary to ensure a sustainable, viable planet. This work includes, but is not limited to, replacing fossil fuels with 100% renewable energy sources on the Eastside and abroad.

data.name: Greenbelt Climate Action Network
data.description: GCAN’s mission is to educate residents about climate change, “systemic” solutions, how they can change their behaviors to be more sustainable, and take political action.

data.name: Harford County Climate Action
data.description: Harford County Climate Action is a new group for local residents who are concerned about climate disruption and who want to do something about it locally.

data.name: 350MA-South Shore
data.description: Join the South Shore node of 350 Mass! 350 Mass is made up of hundreds of highly engaged volunteers all over the state, supported by staff from Better Future Project. 350 Mass educates the public about global warming and advocates for change through hard-hitting campaigns chosen by volunteers Hingham, Braintree, Weymouth, and Quincy residents came together to form the South Shore node in 2013, and the node has been meeting regularly ever since. Contact the node leaders at SouthShore@350ma.org. Check out www.350ma.org for more info, including the location, date and time of the next South Shore node meeting.

data.name: Columbia Gorge Climate Action Network
data.description: CGCAN is a network of Oregon and Washington residents from the Columbia River Gorge National Scenic Area. We are alarmed about the political, economic and social forces causing climate change from all sources, as well as toxic pollution, energy dependence, and local unemployment due to fossil fuels. We are passionately committed to collective and strategic actions that can effectively impede fossil fuels and reduce climate change.

data.name: Houston 350
data.description: This is the site for the newly organized Houston area chapter of 350.org.

data.name: 350 Indiana-Indianapolis
data.description: 350 Indiana-Indianapolis organizes around climate change issues and advances the goals of 350.org. We are part of a global movement that's inspiring the world to rise to the challenge of the climate crisis.

data.name: 350 Joshua Tree
data.description: We are working together to stop climate change globally in accordance with the 350.org agenda -- especially locally to save the dying Joshua Trees.

data.name: 350 Hawaii
data.description: 350 Hawaii is a group of professors, activists, professionals, students and retirees in Hawaii doing what we can to fight climate change in our piece of the world. And maybe more. We divested the 10-campus University of Hawaii system from fossil fuels, and are working on other divestment campaigns.

data.name: 350KC
data.description:
350KC is made up of ordinary Kansas Citians who are determined to preserve a livable climate. We work to:

* Stop tar sands pipelines
* Encourage institutions to divest from fossil fuel companies
* Build support for the federal government to put a price on carbon that internalizes the true costs of fossil fuels in the prices we pay
* Inspire people to embrace a rapid transition from dirty to clean energy

data.name: Kent on Climate
data.description: Kent on Climate is an environmentalist organization founded in the spring of 2016 to unite students, community members and activists in order to combat climate change and build a sustainable future for Kent and the world. Our members coordinate trash cleanups, support local ballot initiatives, and engage in long-term campaigns for fossil fuel divestment and other related causes. We are energetic, we are determined, and we are thrilled to be working with 350.org as part of the global movement to stop catastrophic climate change.

data.name: Lansing 350
data.description: Lansing 350 is a volunteer organization that raises awareness about the climate crisis, the need for immediate action, and the ways individuals can work together to combat climate change.

data.name: Mono Climate Action
data.description: We educate about climate issues and hope to inspire progress toward a sustainable future that protects the climate of our alpine environment, our snow dependent economy and the quality of life for humans and wildlife in the Eastern Sierra.

data.name: 350 Loudoun
data.description: 350 Loudoun is a climate action group that is dedicated to building a positive response to climate change in Loudoun County and to generating general awareness of man-made climate change among county residents.

data.name: Long Beach 350
data.description: Long Beach 350 is a grassroots group of ordinary residents with an extraordinary passion for climate justice. We are a network of volunteers who believe community engagement and strategic partnerships can inspire a solution to the climate crisis and transition Long Beach into a sustainable, clean energy city.

data.name: SoCal 350 Climate Action
data.description: We envision a healthy climate through environmental, social, and economic justice, built and carried by engaged and empowered communities in a fossil fuel-free future

data.name: 350 Louisville
data.description: We are a local 350.org affinity group. We hold 350.org actions to bring awareness to the dangers and injustices of human-induced climate change. We believe that all things are connected and that what we do to Earth we do to ourselves.

data.name: 350MA-Lowell
data.description: Join the Lowell node of 350 Mass! 350 Mass is made up of hundreds of highly engaged volunteers all over the state, supported by staff from Better Future Project. 350 Mass educates the public about global warming and advocates for change through hard-hitting campaigns chosen by volunteers. To contact the Lowell node of 350 Mass, email Lowell@350ma.org. Check out www.350ma.org for more info, including the location, date and time of the next Lowell node meeting.

data.name: 350 Maine: Downeast Node
data.description: 350 Maine is building a grassroots network across the state to address the crisis of climate change and a world too dependent on dirty fossil fuels. We grow our power collectively to find real and lasting solutions, to end our dependence on fossil fuels, and to build a healthy, just, sustainable life for people and the planet.

data.name: 350 Madison
data.description: 350 local organizing group fighting climate change in the Madison, Wisconsin, area.  Please check out our website at 350madison.org for more information!

data.name: 350 Marin
data.description: 350Marin is made up of grassroots activists who are deeply concerned about climate breakdown. Regionally, we're affiliated with 350BayArea, which is working to achieve a significant decrease in all heat-trapping gases both locally and statewide. Globally, we're part of the 350 movement that's continuing to grow in 188 countries around the world. We hope you'll join us.

data.name: 350 South Florida
data.description: The members of 350 South Florida organize around climate change issues and advance the goals of 350.org in the South Florida region, which is ground zero for climate change in the U.S. Our group pressures our local, state, and national elected officials to move toward climate justice for South Florida, including keeping fossil fuels in the ground, mitigating the effects of climate change on health, our economy and our communities, and creating a just and sustainable society.

data.name: 350 Milwaukee
data.description: The Milwaukee Chapter of 350.org promotes local climate change action, awareness, and education through our volunteer grassroots organizing

data.name: 350 MN
data.description: Mn350 is building the climate movement in Minnesota! Join us.

data.name: 350 Missoula
data.description: 350 Missoula works to reduce atmospheric CO2 concentrations to 350 ppm by implementing strategic actions and advocating policies to end fossil fuel burning by 2030.  We envision a rapid conversion to a 100% renewable global energy system using wind, water, and solar.  We work with the global grassroots climate movement to safeguard all life on the planet.

data.name: 350 Montgomery County
data.description: We are a group of Montgomery Co. activists working towards solutions to the climate crisis. Let's make MoCo sell off its millions of dollars in oil & coal investments!

data.name: 350 Louisiana - NOLA

data.name: 350 Bucks County

data.name: North Country 350 Alliance
data.description: The NC 350 Alliance represents the convergence of a number of groups with a long and rich tradition of activism on behalf of sustainability and social justice. Members and constituent groups have been engaged in campaigns against incineration, fracking, and industrial agriculture, and in the promotion of farmers markets, EBT/SNAP access to local foods, sustainable living and alternative energy fairs, school programs on nutrition, and university programs on sustainability, as well as conferences and demonstrations on climate change.

data.name: 350 Triangle

data.name: RF350

data.name: Forest City 350
data.description: Forest City 350 is a diverse group of activists from the Stateline region, centered in Rockford, IL.  We are focused on bringing awareness to climate change and working to create solutions. We are poets, musicians, teachers, pastors, students, activists, artists, stewards, writers, elders and children.

data.name: 350MA-North Shore
data.description: Join the North Shore node of 350 Mass! 350 Mass is made up of hundreds of highly engaged volunteers all over the state, supported by staff from Better Future Project. 350 Mass educates the public about global warming and advocates for change through hard-hitting campaigns chosen by volunteers. The North Shore node includes volunteers from Ipswich, Marblehead, and other nearby towns. Check out www.350ma.org for more info, including the location, date and time of the next North Shore node meeting.

data.name: 350 Salem OR
data.description: 350 Salem Oregon evolved from a loose network of activists who have participated in 350.org and other climate change related events here in Salem, Oregon. Protecting the stability of our climate and adapting to climate change impacts we can no longer avoid are two of the most urgent tasks facing us today. Here in the Pacific Northwest we are at the front lines of a massive expansion of fossil fuel capacity in North America. Even though the Pacific Northwest is known for innovative environmental policy and renewable energy development, fossil fuel companies see our beautiful region as nothing but an express route for coal, oil and natural gas from the interior to West Coast ports and refineries. We are involved with the struggle to stop fossil fuels from traveling on our roads, rails, and waterways. We are in solidarity with the national and international goals of 350.org and are very pleased to be affiliated with the 350.org global network.

data.name: 350 Central Colorado
data.description: 350 Central Colorado is a group of citizens sharing a concern about the emerging regional impact of climate change on our lives in all aspects including health, severe weather events, economy and our future life possibilities.

data.name: 350 SF
data.description: We are grassroots San Francisco activists working, in collaboration with other 350 and local groups, to mitigate and adapt to climate change. Join us in working on local clean energy, fossil fuel resistance, divestment, and energizing and informing the public about climate change.  We look forward to meeting you.

data.name: SLO 350

data.name: 350 Sandpoint
data.description: We are a group of concerned citizens living in and around Sandpoint, Idaho, next to beautiful Lake Pend Oreille. We are organizing specifically to do all we can to slow down global warming, and the resulting climate change.

data.name: Olympic Climate Action
data.description:
We seek a safe, prosperous, sustainable future 
for residents of the Olympic Peninsula 
by addressing the threat of climate change.

data.name: 350 Louisiana - Shreveport / Bossier

In October of 2015, we held the first ever People's Climate March in Sonora, which was part of a nation-wide effort involving hundreds of communities in cities around the world. We now continue our efforts by holding monthly meetings and organizing actions in our community.

data.name: 350 STL
data.description: We are a group of people of all ages, faiths, races, cultures, and professional backgrounds who are single-mindedly pursuing the mission of transitioning the St. Louis area off of fossil fuels in a way that is equitable and just for our most vulnerable populations. We are action-oriented, meet once per month, and have working groups available to join for those who have specific interests and passions. We are thrilled every time someone new brings their energy to the group.

data.description: 350 Stevens Point is a local branch of 350.org that exists to combat rising levels of Carbon Dioxide in the environment through education and activism.

When there is a 350 specific event, we either have breakout meetings at that meeting, or use it to schedule other meeting times that may vary.

data.name: 350 Ventura County
data.description: 350 Ventura County is the Ventura chapter of 350.org. The 350 in 350.org refers to the maximum number of parts of CO2 per million that is considered safe. As of May, 2013, 400 parts per million have been measured in our atmosphere.

data.name: 350 DC
data.description: We're building a stronger movement for climate and environmental justice in DC. Join our email list to get involved : http://eepurl.com/Ww0r5

data.name: Glacier Climate Action
data.description: Glacier Climate Action is a loose confederation of concerned citizens in the communities near Glacier National Park. Join us!

data.name: 350 Central Massachusetts
data.description: 350 Central Massachusetts, a volunteer led, grassroots environmental justice organization. Our goal is combat the climate crisis in Central Massachusetts and beyond.

data.name: Alexandria 350
data.description: Alexandria 350 is a group of volunteer activists committed to increasing awareness of climate change and its effects, promoting 100% use of renewable energy, creating clean-energy jobs and working on other local and state issues of concern to City of Alexandria and Fairfax County residents.

data.name: Ames 350.org
data.description: We aim to facilitate local climate action and awareness in coordination with international 350 efforts and in collaboration with local progressive organizations in Ames, Iowa.

data.name: 350 SE Michigan
data.description: Our group is located in a very environmentally conscious region, but there is still a prevailing sense that climate change is just one issue among many. The goal of 350 SE Michigan is to raise awareness of the emergency nature of global warming and to engage people at all levels in combating it.

data.name: Georgia Climate Change Coalition
data.description: The Georgia Climate Change Coalition is a group of citizens and organizations who share an interest in climate change in Georgia and the Southeast.  Based in Athens, Georgia, we sponsor events and educational programs and promote collaboration between our member groups.

data.name: Baltimore350.org

Our goal is to involve Baltimore area citizens in environmental activism by increasing visibility of local grassroots actions and campaigns and by partnering with other organizations.  We primarily focus on issues and legislation pertaining to solar and renewable energy and water quality.

data.name: 350 Maine: Midcoast Node
data.description: 350 Maine is building a grassroots network across the state to address the crisis of climate change and a world too dependent on dirty fossil fuels. We grow our power collectively to find real and lasting solutions, to end our dependence on fossil fuels, and to build a healthy, just, sustainable life for people and the planet.

data.name: 350Vermont: Climate Advocates Bennington
data.description: 350Vermont organizes, educates, and supports people in Vermont to work together for climate justice – resisting fossil fuels, building momentum for alternatives, and transforming our communities toward justice and resilience.

data.name: 350 SW Idaho
data.description: Empowering and activating Southwest Idaho to organize and educate through creating grassroots awareness that advocates for real and actionable practices to not only reduce our carbon footprint, but also reduce carbon pollution in the air, the water, and the land.

data.name: 350Vermont: Brattleboro Node
data.description: 350Vermont organizes, educates, and supports people in Vermont to work together for climate justice – resisting fossil fuels, building momentum for alternatives, and transforming our communities toward justice and resilience.

data.name: 350Vermont
data.description: In the Green Mountain State, we’re uniting a mass movement for bold solutions that both lift up Vermonters and cut down carbon — to be a national and global example for solving the climate crisis. We believe that everyone has a right to a secure, healthy and ecologically sound environment. 350VT is raising awareness and building resistance to a tar sands pipeline project in the Northeast Kingdom. 350VT works on both the university level and the state level to remove funds from the fossil fuel industry. Our other campaigns and initiatives include Climate Cabaret, Transportation for Livable Communities, and Green Mountain Brigade (solidarity work).

data.name: 350Vermont: Central Vermont Climate Action
data.description: 350Vermont organizes, educates, and supports people in Vermont to work together for climate justice – resisting fossil fuels, building momentum for alternatives, and transforming our communities toward justice and resilience.

data.name: Chicago 350
data.description:
We are a volunteer group working to inspire Chicagoans to take on the challenge of climate change. To envision and build toward a future not dominated by fossil fuels and the environmental destruction caused by their mining and use.

While connected to a global movement, we take action locally based on issues important to the Chicago area and the mid-west.

data.name: 350NH
data.description: 350NH is an open, community led organization. We are working to stop new fossil fuel infrastructure and to bring in renewable energy solutions. To make big change, we need every granite stater, join us: 350NH.org/signup/

data.name: 350Corvallis
data.description: 350Corvallis formed in December 2012 to support grass roots climate action at the local and global level. We have regular meetings, put on educational events and participate in various actions.  We also work with local and statewide coalitions whenever possible. We welcome people from all walks of life to participate in the group.  Click on our group name above to get to our website for the latest information.

data.name: 350 Riverside
data.description: 350 Riverside is a countywide volunteer group of grassroots climate activists. Like 350.org, we are building a movement that can hold our leaders accountable to science and justice. We work to keep fossil fuels in the ground; limit emissions; improve air quality; and build a clean, equitable, zero-carbon economy. We believe in the power of climate justice, collaboration, and mass mobilizations to create change, and we are guided by the principles of nonviolence, openness, inclusivity, and service to the movement.

data.name: Detroit 350
data.description: We are a group of citizens in the Detroit metro area. We come from various backgrounds and activism experience levels but share a passion for working to fight climate change. When and where we can act, we MUST act.

data.name: 350Vermont: Burlington Node
data.description: 350Vermont organizes, educates, and supports people in Vermont to work together for climate justice – resisting fossil fuels, building momentum for alternatives, and transforming our communities toward justice and resilience.

data.name: 350Vermont: Earth Matters (Manchester) Node
data.description: Southern Vermont climate justice group and 350VT node, Earth Matters, is raising consciousness on climate change and ways to mitigate its consequences. Earth Matters is one of three working committees of MoveOn Manchester, a group comprised of Northshire area residents dedicated to working towards a better world, locally and beyond. The three groups meet regularly and welcome new participants.

data.name: 350 Juneau
data.description: 350 JUNEAU was formed in May 2017 to support grass roots climate action at the local, state and national level. We are working to prevent the worst impacts of climate change and to promote a just transition to a clean energy economy through education, public policy advocacy and mobilizing people to take action. We seek a safe, just, and sustainable future for all Alaskans. Get inspired, get involved!

data.name: 350NYC
data.description:
350 NYC is part of a grassroots campaign to solve the global climate crisis. We are part of a network of thousands of volunteer-run campaigns in over 188 countries.

350 means climate safety. To preserve our planet, scientists tell us we must reduce the amount of CO2 in the atmosphere from its current levels of nearly 400 parts per million to below 350 ppm. But 350 is more than a number—it’s a symbol of where we need to head as a planet. We believe that if a global grassroots movement holds our leaders accountable to realities of science and principles of justice, we can realize the solutions that will ensure a better future for all.

data.name: Oxy 350
data.location: Occidental College, Los Angeles, CA, US
data.description: At Oxy 350, we are committed to mobilizing the Occidental College community as part of the global wave of resistance to keep fossil fuels in the ground and accelerate the just transition to 100% renewable energy.

data.name: Mid-Ohio Valley Climate Action
data.description: Our group's purpose is to educate, organize and mobilize citizens of the city of Parkersburg, WV, and the surrounding area to work to tackle the immense challenges of climate change as a nonpartisan, nonprofit group of concerned and active citizens.

data.name: 350 Pensacola
data.description: 350 Pensacola works to empower individuals to take responsibility and to pursue solutions to climate change through local and global action. Providing local support for the international 350.org campaign, the group works along the Gulf Coast to bring people together in a long-term effort to move to the safe upper limit of 350 ppm of CO2 in our atmosphere.

data.name: Phx 350
data.description: We give a climate change presentations to churches, business, and clubs. We support urban forestry projects in two local cities. We lobby local municipalities and we are always up for a march or demonstration. We are a link between student activists and mainstream green groups. We meet on the 2nd Tuesday at 1702 E. Glendale Ave. in Phoenix and online.

data.name: 350 PDX
data.description: Founded in 2013, 350PDX is a rapidly growing volunteer-led nonprofit with neighborhood groups across the Portland area building (1) opposition to fossil fuel exports and new fossil fuel infrastructure in the Northwest, (2) support for fossil fuel divestment at the local and state level, (3) a rapid and just transition to a renewable energy economy. Get inspired, get involved at: 350pdx.org

data.name: Climate Action RI
data.description: We are concerned citizens working to build the climate movement in Rhode Island. An affiliate of 350.org, we’re fighting for 100% renewable energy, a clean and sustainable earth, and environmental justice for all. Join us!

data.name: 350 Sacramento
data.description: 350 Sacramento is working locally to keep the planet from overheating. We’re passionate, we’re fun, we get things done.

data.name: PU Community of Resilience and Resistance (CORR)
data.description: We are involved with the Peaceful Uprising CORR (http://corr.peacefuluprising.org/) model of resilience and resistance.

data.name: SanDiego350
data.description: SanDiego350 is an inclusive volunteer organization devoted to inspiring a movement to prevent the worst impacts of climate change and climate injustice. We strive to create a future that supports a livable planet and just society through education and outreach, public policy advocacy, and mobilizing people to take action.

data.name: 350BayArea
data.description: We are building a grassroots climate movement, working for deep reductions in carbon pollution the San Francisco Bay Area & beyond.  Our vision is: Clean, healthy, and sustainable communities for all, Renewable Energy, Energy Efficiency, Carbon Neutral, An informed and mobilized Bay Area. For all our campaigns and local groups see www.350bayarea.org

data.name: South Bay Los Angeles 350
data.description: South Bay Los Angeles 350 works to mobilize South Bay and LA residents to take action on climate change and climate justice.

data.name: 350 Santa Barbara
data.description:
350 Santa Barbara is a local chapter of 350.org. We seek to
-Bring a greater sense of urgency about climate change to Santa Barbara County and mobilize people toward solutions
-Build the political will to oppose fossil fuel industry projects that damage our health, ecosystem and economy
-Educate about the gravity of climate change while presenting solutions and how to move toward them
-Connect the dots between climate change and social justice issues
-Empower people to become knowledgeable about climate science and to identify misinformation when it is presented

data.name: Santa Cruz Climate Action Network
data.description: We are a diverse group of local people who are highly concerned about current and future climate change. We are affiliated with various groups such as 350 Santa Cruz, Citizens Climate Lobby, System Change not Climate Change, PDC, WILPF, Sierra Club, Pachamama South Bay Group, RCNV, Fossil Free UCSC, UC-AFT Green Caucus and others.

data.name: 350 Seattle
data.description: 350 Seattle is resisting the power of the fossil fuel industry and promoting a just transition to a clean energy economy. Check out our website to read about our campaigns and get involved. www.350seattle.org

data.name: Fossil Free Somerville
data.description: Fossil Free Somerville is a grassroots group of Somerville residents, City workers and retirees who are committed to building a future free from fossil fuels and a strong grassroots climate movement. Building on the successes of the fossil fuel divestment campaign, we pursue strategies to foster a just system based on 100% renewable energy.

data.name: 350 Spokane
data.description: 350 Spokane is building a passionate grassroots movement for climate justice. We believe that climate change is a problem so overwhelming that only people power can begin to solve it. Using tools ranging from policy and advocacy to direct action, we inspire people to fight for the deep and lasting changes necessary to ensure a thriving planet.

data.name: Climate Change Awareness & Action
data.description: CCAA was formed for the purpose of educating others and actively working towards reversing the anthropogenic climate disruption that threatens the earth. Based in Syracuse, NY, we hope that our efforts spread world wide and that everyone will comprehend the importance of this political battle.

data.name: 350 Tacoma
data.description: 350 Tacoma works for a carbon-free future by challenging fossil fuels, standing with our indigenous allies and local workers, and advocating for a just transition to a green economy. Check out our website to read about our campaigns and get involved.

data.name: 350DE at Tatnall
data.description: 350DE at Tatnall is comprised of concerned faculty, staff, and students from The Tatnall School and local citizens from the Wilmington area in Newcastle County, Delaware. We believe that it is important for everyone to understand the science of climate change, the social injustices it brings, and actions that communities and individuals can take in their own lives to decrease their carbon footprint.

data.name: 350Vermont: Upper Valley Node
data.description: 350Vermont organizes, educates, and supports people in Vermont to work together for climate justice – resisting fossil fuels, building momentum for alternatives, and transforming our communities toward justice and resilience.

data.name: Go Green Wilmette
data.description: The mission of Go Green Wilmette is to raise environmental awareness in the Wilmette community and to inspire residents, businesses, and government to take action to make a difference.

data.name: 350 Uruguay
data.description: En Uruguay trabajamos con el movimiento 350.org Uruguay y con el grupo local Asociación Civil Ambientalista de Salto: Salteños en Defensa de los Bienes Naturales (ACAS).

data.name: 350 Vietnam
data.description: 350 Vietnam is the largest youth led climate change movement in the country since its establishment in 2011. As part of the international 350 movement its mission is to promote, inspire and engage the public to adopt green living and production practices as practical contributions to slowing down the global climate change, and offer support to climate change affected communities.
